```diff
+         if (parent) {
+           const points = [
+             new THREE.Vector3(commit.x, commit.y, commit.z),
+             new THREE.Vector3(parent.x, parent.y, parent.z)
+           ]
+           const geometry = new THREE.BufferGeometry().setFromPoints(points)
+           
+           lines.push(
+             &lt;line key={&#96;${commit.sha}-${parentSha}&#96;} geometry={geometry}&gt;
+               &lt;lineBasicMaterial color=&quot;#666666&quot; linewidth={2} /&gt;
+             &lt;/line&gt;
+           )
+         }
+       })
+     })
+     
+     return lines
+   }, [commits])
+   
+   return &lt;&gt;{lines}&lt;/&gt;
+ }
+ 
+ export default function Scene3D({ commits, onCommitClick, selectedCommitSha }: Scene3DProps) {
+   return (
+     &lt;Canvas&gt;
+       &lt;PerspectiveCamera makeDefault position={[0, 0, 50]} /&gt;
+       &lt;ambientLight intensity={0.6} /&gt;
+       &lt;directionalLight position={[10, 10, 5]} intensity={0.8} /&gt;
+       &lt;pointLight position={[-10, -10, -5]} intensity={0.5} /&gt;
+       
+       &lt;CommitNodes 
+         commits={commits}
+         onCommitClick={onCommitClick}
+         selectedCommitSha={selectedCommitSha}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;CommitEdges commits={commits} /&gt;
+       
+       &lt;gridHelper args={[100, 50]} position={[0, -10, 0]} /&gt;
+       &lt;OrbitControls enableDamping dampingFactor={0.05} /&gt;
+     &lt;/Canvas&gt;
+   )
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ // Scene4D.tsx - 4D Git Visualization with Time-Travel Axis
+ // Extends Scene3D with W-dimension (time axis) for Kamui4d-style visualization

+ import { useState, useMemo } from &#39;react&#39;

+   selectedCommitSha?: string

+ 
+ function adjustColorBrightness(hexColor: string, factor: number): string {
+   const color = new THREE.Color(hexColor)
+   color.multiplyScalar(0.5 + factor * 0.5)
+   return &#39;#&#39; + color.getHexString()
+ }

+ export default function Scene4D({ commits, onCommitClick, selectedCommitSha }: Scene4DProps) {
```

```diff
+ // GPUOptimizer.tsx - GPU rendering optimization for large commit graphs
+ // Automatically adjusts LOD and rendering settings based on commit count
+ 
+ import { useEffect, useRef } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { useThree } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ 
+ interface GPUOptimizerProps {
+   commitCount: number
+   maxFPS?: number
+   enableShadows?: boolean
+ }
+ 
+ export function GPUOptimizer({ 
+   commitCount, 
+   maxFPS = 60,
+   enableShadows = false 
+ }: GPUOptimizerProps) {
+   const { gl, scene } = useThree()
+   const lastTimeRef = useRef(0)
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // WebGL optimization settings
+     gl.setPixelRatio(Math.min(window.devicePixelRatio, 2))
+     gl.shadowMap.enabled = enableShadows
+     
+     // Power preference
+     const canvas = gl.domElement
+     const context = canvas.getContext(&#39;webgl2&#39;, {
+       powerPreference: &#39;high-performance&#39;,
+       antialias: commitCount &lt; 500
+     })
+     
+     console.log(&#39;[GPU Optimizer] Initialized&#39;, {
+       commits: commitCount,
+       maxFPS,
+       shadows: enableShadows,
+       pixelRatio: gl.getPixelRatio()
+     })
+   }, [gl, commitCount, maxFPS, enableShadows])
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // Auto LOD for large commit graphs
+     if (commitCount &gt; 100) {
+       console.log(&#39;[GPU Optimizer] Applying LOD optimizations&#39;)
+       
+       scene.traverse((object) =&gt; {
+         if (object instanceof THREE.Mesh) {
+           // Simplify geometry for large datasets
+           const mesh = object as THREE.Mesh
+           
+           if (commitCount &gt; 500) {
+             // Very aggressive LOD
+             if (mesh.geometry instanceof THREE.SphereGeometry) {
+               // Reduce sphere segments
+               const newGeometry = new THREE.SphereGeometry(
+                 0.5,
+                 8,  // widthSegments (reduced from 16)
+                 8   // heightSegments (reduced from 16)
+               )
+               mesh.geometry.dispose()
+               mesh.geometry = newGeometry
+             }
+           } else if (commitCount &gt; 200) {
+             // Moderate LOD
+             if (mesh.geometry instanceof THREE.SphereGeometry) {
+               const newGeometry = new THREE.SphereGeometry(
+                 0.5,
+                 12,  // widthSegments
+                 12   // heightSegments
+               )
+               mesh.geometry.dispose()
+               mesh.geometry = newGeometry
+             }
+           }
+           
+           // Disable frustum culling for instanced meshes (they handle it internally)
+           if (mesh instanceof THREE.InstancedMesh) {
+             mesh.frustumCulled = true
+           }
+         }
+       })
+     }
+   }, [commitCount, scene])
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // FPS limiter
+     const animate = (time: number) =&gt; {
+       const delta = time - lastTimeRef.current
+       
+       if (delta &gt;= 1000 / maxFPS) {
+         lastTimeRef.current = time
+         
+         // Performance monitoring
+         if (delta &gt; 1000 / 30) {
+           console.warn(&#39;[GPU Optimizer] Low FPS detected:&#39;, {
+             fps: Math.round(1000 / delta),
+             commits: commitCount
+           })
+         }
+       }
+       
+       requestAnimationFrame(animate)
+     }
+     
+     const animationId = requestAnimationFrame(animate)
+     
+     return () =&gt; {
+       cancelAnimationFrame(animationId)
+     }
+   }, [maxFPS, commitCount])
+   
+   return null
+ }
+ 
+ // Performance stats component
+ export function GPUPerformanceStats({ show = false }: { show?: boolean }) {
+   const { gl } = useThree()
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     if (!show) return
+     
+     const interval = setInterval(() =&gt; {
+       const info = gl.info
+       console.log(&#39;[GPU Stats]&#39;, {
+         geometries: info.memory.geometries,
+         textures: info.memory.textures,
+         programs: info.programs?.length || 0,
+         calls: info.render.calls,
+         triangles: info.render.triangles,
+         points: info.render.points
+       })
+     }, 5000)
+     
+     return () =&gt; clearInterval(interval)
+   }, [gl, show])
+   
+   return null
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ //! Commit quality analysis using AI
+ //! 
+ //! Analyzes commit quality across multiple dimensions:
+ //! - Code quality and complexity
+ //! - Test coverage
+ //! - Documentation completeness
+ //! - Best practices adherence
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ 
+ /// AI-analyzed commit quality metrics
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct CommitQualityScore {
+     /// Commit SHA
+     pub sha: String,
+     
+     /// Code quality score (0-100)
+     pub code_quality: f32,
+     
+     /// Test coverage score (0-100)
+     pub test_coverage: f32,
+     
+     /// Documentation completeness (0-100)
+     pub documentation: f32,
+     
+     /// Code complexity (0-100, lower is better)
+     pub complexity: f32,
+     
+     /// Overall quality score (0-100)
+     pub overall: f32,
+     
+     /// AI-generated insights
+     pub insights: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     /// Detected issues
+     pub issues: Vec&lt;QualityIssue&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct QualityIssue {
+     pub severity: IssueSeverity,
+     pub category: IssueCategory,
+     pub description: String,
+     pub file_path: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub line_number: Option&lt;usize&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ #[serde(rename_all = &quot;lowercase&quot;)]
+ pub enum IssueSeverity {
+     Critical,
+     High,
+     Medium,
+     Low,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ #[serde(rename_all = &quot;snake_case&quot;)]
+ pub enum IssueCategory {
+     CodeQuality,
+     Security,
+     Performance,
+     Maintainability,
+     Testing,
+     Documentation,
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct CommitQualityAnalyzer {
+     // Future: AI model integration
+ }
+ 
+ impl CommitQualityAnalyzer {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self {}
+     }
+     
+     /// Analyze commit quality using AI
+     pub async fn analyze_commit(
+         &amp;self,
+         repo_path: &amp;str,
+         commit_sha: &amp;str,
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;CommitQualityScore&gt; {
+         // TODO: Integrate with Codex API for AI analysis
+         // For now, return mock data for UI development
+         
+         let mock_score = self.generate_mock_score(commit_sha);
+         Ok(mock_score)
+     }
+     
+     /// Analyze multiple commits in batch
+     pub async fn analyze_commits_batch(
+         &amp;self,
+         repo_path: &amp;str,
+         commit_shas: &amp;[String],
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;CommitQualityScore&gt;&gt; {
+         let mut scores = Vec::new();
+         
+         for sha in commit_shas {
+             let score = self.analyze_commit(repo_path, sha).await?;
+             scores.push(score);
+         }
+         
+         Ok(scores)
+     }
+     
+     // Mock data generator for development
+     fn generate_mock_score(&amp;self, sha: &amp;str) -&gt; CommitQualityScore {
+         // Generate pseudo-random but consistent scores based on SHA
+         let hash_val = sha.bytes().fold(0u32, |acc, b| acc.wrapping_add(b as u32));
+         let base_score = (hash_val % 40) as f32 + 50.0;  // 50-90 range
+         
+         CommitQualityScore {
+             sha: sha.to_string(),
+             code_quality: base_score + ((hash_val % 10) as f32),
+             test_coverage: base_score - ((hash_val % 15) as f32),
+             documentation: base_score + ((hash_val % 5) as f32),
+             complexity: 100.0 - base_score,  // Inverse for complexity
+             overall: base_score,
+             insights: vec![
+                 &quot;Code follows project conventions&quot;.to_string(),
+                 &quot;Good variable naming&quot;.to_string(),
+             ],
+             issues: vec![],
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for CommitQualityAnalyzer {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::new()
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Get color representation for quality score
+ pub fn score_to_color(score: f32) -&gt; &amp;&#39;static str {
+     match score {
+         s if s &gt;= 80.0 =&gt; &quot;#00ff00&quot;,  // Green: High quality
+         s if s &gt;= 60.0 =&gt; &quot;#ffff00&quot;,  // Yellow: Medium quality
+         s if s &gt;= 40.0 =&gt; &quot;#ff8800&quot;,  // Orange: Needs improvement
+         _ =&gt; &quot;#ff0000&quot;,                // Red: Low quality
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Get color as RGB hex
+ pub fn score_to_rgb(score: f32) -&gt; (u8, u8, u8) {
+     match score {
+         s if s &gt;= 80.0 =&gt; (0, 255, 0),
+         s if s &gt;= 60.0 =&gt; (255, 255, 0),
+         s if s &gt;= 40.0 =&gt; (255, 136, 0),
+         _ =&gt; (255, 0, 0),
+     }
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ import { useMemo } from &#39;react&#39;
+ 
+ interface CommitQualityBadgeProps {

+   size?: &#39;small&#39; | &#39;medium&#39; | &#39;large&#39;

+ }
+ 
+ export function CommitQualityBadge({ 
+   score, 
+   size = &#39;medium&#39;,
+   showLabel = true 
+ }: CommitQualityBadgeProps) {
+   const { color, label } = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     if (score &gt;= 80) return { color: &#39;#00ff00&#39;, label: &#39;High&#39; }
+     if (score &gt;= 60) return { color: &#39;#ffff00&#39;, label: &#39;Medium&#39; }
+     if (score &gt;= 40) return { color: &#39;#ff8800&#39;, label: &#39;Low&#39; }
+     return { color: &#39;#ff0000&#39;, label: &#39;Critical&#39; }
+   }, [score])
+ 
+   const sizeMap = {
+     small: { width: 40, height: 20, fontSize: 10 },
+     medium: { width: 60, height: 24, fontSize: 12 },
+     large: { width: 80, height: 32, fontSize: 14 }
+   }
+ 
+   const dimensions = sizeMap[size]
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;div
+       style={{
+         display: &#39;inline-flex&#39;,
+         alignItems: &#39;center&#39;,
+         justifyContent: &#39;center&#39;,
+         width: dimensions.width,
+         height: dimensions.height,
+         backgroundColor: color,
+         color: &#39;#000&#39;,
+         borderRadius: 4,
+         fontSize: dimensions.fontSize,
+         fontWeight: &#39;bold&#39;,
+         padding: &#39;2px 6px&#39;,
+         boxShadow: &#39;0 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.2)&#39;,
+       }}
+     &gt;
+       {showLabel ? label : Math.round(score)}
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ interface QualityScoreRingProps {
+   score: number
+   size?: number
+ }
+ 
+ export function QualityScoreRing({ score, size = 50 }: QualityScoreRingProps) {
+   const color = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     if (score &gt;= 80) return &#39;#00ff00&#39;
+     if (score &gt;= 60) return &#39;#ffff00&#39;
+     if (score &gt;= 40) return &#39;#ff8800&#39;
+     return &#39;#ff0000&#39;
+   }, [score])
+ 
+   const circumference = 2 * Math.PI * (size / 2 - 5)
+   const strokeDashoffset = circumference - (score / 100) * circumference
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;svg width={size} height={size}&gt;
+       &lt;circle
+         cx={size / 2}
+         cy={size / 2}
+         r={size / 2 - 5}
+         fill=&quot;transparent&quot;
+         stroke=&quot;#333&quot;
+         strokeWidth=&quot;3&quot;
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;circle
+         cx={size / 2}
+         cy={size / 2}
+         r={size / 2 - 5}
+         fill=&quot;transparent&quot;
+         stroke={color}
+         strokeWidth=&quot;3&quot;
+         strokeDasharray={circumference}
+         strokeDashoffset={strokeDashoffset}
+         transform={&#96;rotate(-90 ${size / 2} ${size / 2})&#96;}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;text
+         x=&quot;50%&quot;
+         y=&quot;50%&quot;
+         textAnchor=&quot;middle&quot;
+         dy=&quot;.3em&quot;
+         fontSize={size / 3}
+         fill=&quot;#fff&quot;
+         fontWeight=&quot;bold&quot;
+       &gt;
+         {Math.round(score)}
+       &lt;/text&gt;
+     &lt;/svg&gt;
+   )
+ }
```

```diff
+ //! Parallel AI execution orchestration
+ //! 
+ //! Executes multiple AI agents (Codex, GeminiCLI, Claudecode) in parallel
+ //! for competition-style development with worktree isolation.
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use std::collections::HashMap;
+ use std::sync::Arc;
+ use tokio::sync::RwLock;
+ use tokio::task::JoinHandle;
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, Serialize, Deserialize, PartialEq, Eq, Hash)]
+ #[serde(rename_all = &quot;lowercase&quot;)]
+ pub enum AgentType {
+     Codex,
+     GeminiCLI,
+     Claudecode,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct AgentTask {
+     pub agent: AgentType,
+     pub prompt: String,
+     pub worktree_path: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub timeout_seconds: Option&lt;u64&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct AgentResult {
+     pub agent: AgentType,
+     pub success: bool,
+     pub output: String,
+     pub elapsed_seconds: f64,
+     pub error: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub enum AgentStatus {
+     Pending,
+     Running,
+     Completed,
+     Failed,
+     Timeout,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct AgentProgress {
+     pub agent: AgentType,
+     pub status: AgentStatus,
+     pub progress_percent: f32,
+     pub current_step: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct ParallelOrchestrator {
+     agent_states: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl ParallelOrchestrator {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             agent_states: Arc::new(RwLock::new(HashMap::new())),
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Execute multiple AI agents in parallel
+     pub async fn execute_parallel(
+         &amp;self,
+         tasks: Vec&lt;AgentTask&gt;,
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;AgentResult&gt;&gt; {
+         let mut handles: Vec&lt;JoinHandle&lt;AgentResult&gt;&gt; = Vec::new();
+ 
+         for task in tasks {
+             // Initialize agent state
+             {
+                 let mut states = self.agent_states.write().await;
+                 states.insert(
+                     task.agent,
+                     AgentProgress {
+                         agent: task.agent,
+                         status: AgentStatus::Pending,
+                         progress_percent: 0.0,
+                         current_step: None,
+                     },
+                 );
+             }
+ 
+             let states = Arc::clone(&amp;self.agent_states);
+             let handle = tokio::spawn(async move {
+                 Self::execute_agent(states, task).await
+             });
+ 
+             handles.push(handle);
+         }
+ 
+         // Wait for all agents to complete
+         let mut results = Vec::new();
+         for handle in handles {
+             match handle.await {
+                 Ok(result) =&gt; results.push(result),
+                 Err(e) =&gt; {
+                     eprintln!(&quot;Agent task panicked: {}&quot;, e);
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(results)
+     }
+ 
+     async fn execute_agent(
+         states: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+         task: AgentTask,
+     ) -&gt; AgentResult {
+         let start = std::time::Instant::now();
+ 
+         // Update status to Running
+         {
+             let mut state_map = states.write().await;
+             if let Some(state) = state_map.get_mut(&amp;task.agent) {
+                 state.status = AgentStatus::Running;
+                 state.current_step = Some(&quot;Initializing&quot;.to_string());
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         // Execute agent (mock implementation for now)
+         let result = Self::run_agent(&amp;task, states.clone()).await;
+ 
+         let elapsed = start.elapsed().as_secs_f64();
+ 
+         // Update final status
+         {
+             let mut state_map = states.write().await;
+             if let Some(state) = state_map.get_mut(&amp;task.agent) {
+                 state.status = if result.is_ok() {
+                     AgentStatus::Completed
+                 } else {
+                     AgentStatus::Failed
+                 };
+                 state.progress_percent = 100.0;
+                 state.current_step = None;
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         match result {
+             Ok(output) =&gt; AgentResult {
+                 agent: task.agent,
+                 success: true,
+                 output,
+                 elapsed_seconds: elapsed,
+                 error: None,
+             },
+             Err(e) =&gt; AgentResult {
+                 agent: task.agent,
+                 success: false,
+                 output: String::new(),
+                 elapsed_seconds: elapsed,
+                 error: Some(e.to_string()),
+             },
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     async fn run_agent(
+         task: &amp;AgentTask,
+         states: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+         match task.agent {
+             AgentType::Codex =&gt; Self::run_codex(task, states).await,
+             AgentType::GeminiCLI =&gt; Self::run_gemini(task, states).await,
+             AgentType::Claudecode =&gt; Self::run_claude(task, states).await,
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     async fn run_codex(
+         task: &amp;AgentTask,
+         states: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+         // TODO: Integrate with actual Codex CLI
+         Self::update_progress(states, task.agent, 30.0, &quot;Analyzing code&quot;).await;
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(500)).await;
+ 
+         Self::update_progress(states, task.agent, 60.0, &quot;Generating solution&quot;).await;
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(500)).await;
+ 
+         Self::update_progress(states, task.agent, 90.0, &quot;Applying changes&quot;).await;
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(300)).await;
+ 
+         Ok(format!(&quot;Codex completed: {}&quot;, task.prompt))
+     }
+ 
+     async fn run_gemini(
+         task: &amp;AgentTask,
+         states: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+         // TODO: Integrate with GeminiCLI
+         Self::update_progress(states, task.agent, 25.0, &quot;Connecting to Gemini&quot;).await;
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(400)).await;
+ 
+         Self::update_progress(states, task.agent, 70.0, &quot;Processing with Gemini&quot;).await;
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(600)).await;
+ 
+         Ok(format!(&quot;GeminiCLI completed: {}&quot;, task.prompt))
+     }
+ 
+     async fn run_claude(
+         task: &amp;AgentTask,
+         states: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+         // TODO: Integrate with Claudecode
+         Self::update_progress(states, task.agent, 40.0, &quot;Initializing Claude&quot;).await;
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(450)).await;
+ 
+         Self::update_progress(states, task.agent, 80.0, &quot;Executing with Claude&quot;).await;
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(550)).await;
+ 
+         Ok(format!(&quot;Claudecode completed: {}&quot;, task.prompt))
+     }
+ 
+     async fn update_progress(
+         states: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+         agent: AgentType,
+         progress: f32,
+         step: &amp;str,
+     ) {
+         let mut state_map = states.write().await;
+         if let Some(state) = state_map.get_mut(&amp;agent) {
+             state.progress_percent = progress;
+             state.current_step = Some(step.to_string());
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get current progress of all agents
+     pub async fn get_progress(&amp;self) -&gt; HashMap&lt;AgentType, AgentProgress&gt; {
+         self.agent_states.read().await.clone()
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get progress for a specific agent
+     pub async fn get_agent_progress(&amp;self, agent: AgentType) -&gt; Option&lt;AgentProgress&gt; {
+         self.agent_states.read().await.get(&amp;agent).cloned()
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for ParallelOrchestrator {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::new()
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Compare and merge results from multiple agents
+ pub fn compare_results(results: &amp;[AgentResult]) -&gt; ComparisonResult {
+     let successful = results.iter().filter(|r| r.success).count();
+     let failed = results.iter().filter(|r| !r.success).count();
+ 
+     let fastest = results
+         .iter()
+         .filter(|r| r.success)
+         .min_by(|a, b| a.elapsed_seconds.partial_cmp(&amp;b.elapsed_seconds).unwrap());
+ 
+     ComparisonResult {
+         total_agents: results.len(),
+         successful,
+         failed,
+         fastest_agent: fastest.map(|r| r.agent),
+         fastest_time: fastest.map(|r| r.elapsed_seconds),
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ComparisonResult {
+     pub total_agents: usize,
+     pub successful: usize,
```

```diff
+ //! Git worktree manager for competition-style development
+ //! 
+ //! Creates isolated worktrees for each AI agent to work independently,
+ //! then merges the best result back to the main branch.
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use std::path::{Path, PathBuf};
+ use std::process::Command;
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct WorktreeInfo {
+     pub name: String,
+     pub path: PathBuf,
+     pub branch: String,
+     pub agent: String,
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct WorktreeManager {
+     repo_path: PathBuf,
+     worktree_base: PathBuf,
+ }
+ 
+ impl WorktreeManager {
+     pub fn new(repo_path: impl AsRef&lt;Path&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         let repo_path = repo_path.as_ref().to_path_buf();
+         let worktree_base = repo_path.join(&quot;.codex-worktrees&quot;);
+ 
+         // Create worktree base directory if it doesn&#39;t exist
+         if !worktree_base.exists() {
+             std::fs::create_dir_all(&amp;worktree_base)
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to create worktree base directory&quot;)?;
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(Self {
+             repo_path,
+             worktree_base,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Create a new worktree for an agent
+     pub fn create_worktree(&amp;self, agent_name: &amp;str, task_id: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;WorktreeInfo&gt; {
+         let branch_name = format!(&quot;codex/{}/{}&quot;, agent_name, task_id);
+         let worktree_name = format!(&quot;{}_{}&quot;, agent_name, task_id);
+         let worktree_path = self.worktree_base.join(&amp;worktree_name);
+ 
+         // Remove existing worktree if present
+         if worktree_path.exists() {
+             self.remove_worktree(&amp;worktree_name)?;
+         }
+ 
+         // Create new branch
+         let output = Command::new(&quot;git&quot;)
+             .current_dir(&amp;self.repo_path)
+             .args([&quot;branch&quot;, &amp;branch_name])
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to create branch&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if !output.status.success() {
+             let stderr = String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr);
+             // Ignore &quot;already exists&quot; error
+             if !stderr.contains(&quot;already exists&quot;) {
+                 anyhow::bail!(&quot;Git branch creation failed: {}&quot;, stderr);
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         // Create worktree
+         let output = Command::new(&quot;git&quot;)
+             .current_dir(&amp;self.repo_path)
+             .args([
+                 &quot;worktree&quot;,
+                 &quot;add&quot;,
+                 worktree_path.to_str().unwrap(),
+                 &amp;branch_name,
+             ])
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to create worktree&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if !output.status.success() {
+             let stderr = String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr);
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;Git worktree creation failed: {}&quot;, stderr);
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(WorktreeInfo {
+             name: worktree_name,
+             path: worktree_path,
+             branch: branch_name,
+             agent: agent_name.to_string(),
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Remove a worktree and its branch
+     pub fn remove_worktree(&amp;self, worktree_name: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let worktree_path = self.worktree_base.join(worktree_name);
+ 
+         if worktree_path.exists() {
+             let output = Command::new(&quot;git&quot;)
+                 .current_dir(&amp;self.repo_path)
+                 .args([&quot;worktree&quot;, &quot;remove&quot;, worktree_path.to_str().unwrap(), &quot;--force&quot;])
+                 .output()
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to remove worktree&quot;)?;
+ 
+             if !output.status.success() {
+                 let stderr = String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr);
+                 eprintln!(&quot;Warning: Failed to remove worktree: {}&quot;, stderr);
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// List all active worktrees
+     pub fn list_worktrees(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;WorktreeInfo&gt;&gt; {
+         let output = Command::new(&quot;git&quot;)
+             .current_dir(&amp;self.repo_path)
+             .args([&quot;worktree&quot;, &quot;list&quot;, &quot;--porcelain&quot;])
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to list worktrees&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if !output.status.success() {
+             let stderr = String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr);
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;Git worktree list failed: {}&quot;, stderr);
+         }
+ 
+         let stdout = String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stdout);
+         let mut worktrees = Vec::new();
+ 
+         for chunk in stdout.split(&quot;\n\n&quot;) {
+             let lines: Vec&lt;&amp;str&gt; = chunk.lines().collect();
+             if lines.len() &lt; 2 {
+                 continue;
+             }
+ 
+             let path = lines[0].trim_start_matches(&quot;worktree &quot;);
+             let branch = lines[1].trim_start_matches(&quot;branch &quot;);
+ 
+             // Only include our managed worktrees
+             if let Some(name) = Path::new(path)
+                 .file_name()
+                 .and_then(|n| n.to_str())
+             {
+                 if path.contains(&quot;.codex-worktrees&quot;) {
+                     let agent = name.split(&#39;_&#39;).next().unwrap_or(&quot;unknown&quot;).to_string();
+ 
+                     worktrees.push(WorktreeInfo {
+                         name: name.to_string(),
+                         path: PathBuf::from(path),
+                         branch: branch.to_string(),
+                         agent,
+                     });
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(worktrees)
+     }
+ 
+     /// Merge a worktree branch back to main
+     pub fn merge_worktree(&amp;self, worktree_info: &amp;WorktreeInfo, target_branch: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         // Switch to target branch
+         let output = Command::new(&quot;git&quot;)
+             .current_dir(&amp;self.repo_path)
+             .args([&quot;checkout&quot;, target_branch])
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to checkout target branch&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if !output.status.success() {
+             let stderr = String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr);
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;Git checkout failed: {}&quot;, stderr);
+         }
+ 
+         // Merge worktree branch
+         let output = Command::new(&quot;git&quot;)
+             .current_dir(&amp;self.repo_path)
+             .args([&quot;merge&quot;, &amp;worktree_info.branch, &quot;--no-ff&quot;])
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to merge worktree&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if !output.status.success() {
+             let stderr = String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr);
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;Git merge failed: {}&quot;, stderr);
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Clean up all managed worktrees
+     pub fn cleanup_all(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let worktrees = self.list_worktrees()?;
+ 
+         for worktree in worktrees {
+             self.remove_worktree(&amp;worktree.name)?;
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
+ }
+ 
+ impl OrchestrationState {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             orchestrator: Arc::new(RwLock::new(ParallelOrchestrator::new())),
+         }
+     }
+ }

+ #[command]
+ pub async fn orchestrate_parallel(
+     state: State&lt;&#39;_, OrchestrationState&gt;,
+     tasks: Vec&lt;AgentTask&gt;,

+     let orchestrator = state.orchestrator.read().await;
```

```diff
+ //! Dynamic resource management for parallel AI agent execution
+ //! 
+ //! Manages system resources (CPU, memory) and controls concurrent execution
+ //! to prevent system overload while maximizing throughput.
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use std::sync::Arc;
+ use sysinfo::{System, CpuRefreshKind, MemoryRefreshKind, RefreshKind};
+ use tokio::sync::{RwLock, Semaphore};
+ use tracing::{debug, info, warn};
+ 
+ /// Resource capacity information
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ResourceCapacity {
+     /// Maximum concurrent tasks allowed
+     pub max_concurrent: usize,
+     /// Currently active tasks
+     pub active_tasks: usize,
+     /// Available slots for new tasks
+     pub available_slots: usize,
+ }
+ 
+ /// System resource statistics
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct SystemStats {
+     /// CPU usage percentage (0-100)
+     pub cpu_usage_percent: f32,
+     /// Memory used in bytes
+     pub memory_used_bytes: u64,
+     /// Total memory in bytes
+     pub memory_total_bytes: u64,
+     /// Memory usage percentage (0-100)
+     pub memory_usage_percent: f32,
+     /// Number of active agent tasks
+     pub active_agents: usize,
+     /// Number of CPU cores
+     pub cpu_cores: usize,
+ }
+ 
+ /// RAII guard for resource slots
+ /// Automatically releases slot when dropped
+ pub struct ResourceGuard {
+     _permit: tokio::sync::SemaphorePermit&lt;&#39;static&gt;,
+     active_tasks: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;usize&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl Drop for ResourceGuard {
+     fn drop(&amp;mut self) {
+         // Note: We can&#39;t await in Drop, so we spawn a task
+         let active_tasks = Arc::clone(&amp;self.active_tasks);
+         tokio::spawn(async move {
+             let mut tasks = active_tasks.write().await;
+             if *tasks &gt; 0 {
+                 *tasks -= 1;
+             }
+         });
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Manages dynamic resource allocation for agent orchestration
+ pub struct ResourceManager {
+     /// Maximum concurrent tasks (CPU cores * 2)
+     max_concurrent: usize,
+     /// Currently active task count
+     active_tasks: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;usize&gt;&gt;,
+     /// Semaphore to limit concurrent execution
+     semaphore: &amp;&#39;static Semaphore,
+     /// System information tracker
+     system: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;System&gt;&gt;,
+     /// CPU core count
+     cpu_cores: usize,
+ }
+ 
+ impl ResourceManager {
+     /// Create a new resource manager with auto-detected CPU capacity
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::with_multiplier(2)
+     }
+ 
+     /// Create a resource manager with custom CPU multiplier
+     /// 
+     /// # Arguments
+     /// * &#96;multiplier&#96; - Multiply CPU cores by this value for max concurrent tasks
+     pub fn with_multiplier(multiplier: usize) -&gt; Self {
+         let mut sys = System::new_with_specifics(
+             RefreshKind::new()
+                 .with_cpu(CpuRefreshKind::everything())
+                 .with_memory(MemoryRefreshKind::everything()),
+         );
+         
+         // Refresh to get initial data
+         sys.refresh_cpu_all();
+         sys.refresh_memory();
+         
+         let cpu_cores = sys.cpus().len();
+         let max_concurrent = cpu_cores * multiplier;
+         
+         info!(
+             &quot;Initializing ResourceManager: {} CPU cores, max {} concurrent tasks&quot;,
+             cpu_cores, max_concurrent
+         );
+         
+         // Leak semaphore to get &#39;static lifetime (safe for long-lived resource)
+         let semaphore = Box::leak(Box::new(Semaphore::new(max_concurrent)));
+         
+         Self {
+             max_concurrent,
+             active_tasks: Arc::new(RwLock::new(0)),
+             semaphore,
+             system: Arc::new(RwLock::new(sys)),
+             cpu_cores,
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Acquire a resource slot, waiting if necessary
+     /// 
+     /// Returns a guard that automatically releases the slot when dropped
+     pub async fn acquire_slot(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;ResourceGuard&gt; {
+         debug!(&quot;Acquiring resource slot...&quot;);
+         
+         // Wait for available slot
+         let permit = self
+             .semaphore
+             .acquire()
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to acquire semaphore permit&quot;)?;
+         
+         // Increment active task count
+         {
+             let mut tasks = self.active_tasks.write().await;
+             *tasks += 1;
+         }
+         
+         let active = self.get_active_tasks().await;
+         debug!(&quot;Resource slot acquired. Active tasks: {}/{}&quot;, active, self.max_concurrent);
+         
+         Ok(ResourceGuard {
+             _permit: permit,
+             active_tasks: Arc::clone(&amp;self.active_tasks),
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get number of available slots
+     pub fn get_available_slots(&amp;self) -&gt; usize {
+         self.semaphore.available_permits()
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get current number of active tasks
+     pub async fn get_active_tasks(&amp;self) -&gt; usize {
+         *self.active_tasks.read().await
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get resource capacity information
+     pub async fn get_capacity(&amp;self) -&gt; ResourceCapacity {
+         let active = self.get_active_tasks().await;
+         let available = self.get_available_slots();
+         
+         ResourceCapacity {
+             max_concurrent: self.max_concurrent,
+             active_tasks: active,
+             available_slots: available,
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get current system resource statistics
+     pub async fn get_system_stats(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;SystemStats&gt; {
+         let mut sys = self.system.write().await;
+         
+         // Refresh system info
+         sys.refresh_cpu_usage();
+         sys.refresh_memory();
+         
+         // Calculate average CPU usage across all cores
+         let cpu_usage: f32 = sys.cpus().iter().map(|cpu| cpu.cpu_usage()).sum::&lt;f32&gt;() 
+             / sys.cpus().len() as f32;
+         
+         let memory_used = sys.used_memory();
+         let memory_total = sys.total_memory();
+         let memory_percent = if memory_total &gt; 0 {
+             (memory_used as f32 / memory_total as f32) * 100.0
+         } else {
+             0.0
+         };
+         
+         let active_agents = self.get_active_tasks().await;
+         
+         debug!(
+             &quot;System stats: CPU {:.1}%, Memory {:.1}% ({} MB / {} MB), Active agents: {}&quot;,
+             cpu_usage,
+             memory_percent,
+             memory_used / 1024 / 1024,
+             memory_total / 1024 / 1024,
+             active_agents
+         );
+         
+         Ok(SystemStats {
+             cpu_usage_percent: cpu_usage,
+             memory_used_bytes: memory_used,
+             memory_total_bytes: memory_total,
+             memory_usage_percent: memory_percent,
+             active_agents,
+             cpu_cores: self.cpu_cores,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Check if system resources are under high load
+     /// 
+     /// Returns true if CPU &gt; 90% or Memory &gt; 90%
+     pub async fn is_under_high_load(&amp;self) -&gt; bool {
+         match self.get_system_stats().await {
+             Ok(stats) =&gt; {
+                 let high_load = stats.cpu_usage_percent &gt; 90.0 
+                     || stats.memory_usage_percent &gt; 90.0;
+                 
+                 if high_load {
+                     warn!(
+                         &quot;System under high load: CPU {:.1}%, Memory {:.1}%&quot;,
+                         stats.cpu_usage_percent, stats.memory_usage_percent
+                     );
+                 }
+                 
+                 high_load
+             }
+             Err(e) =&gt; {
+                 warn!(&quot;Failed to check system load: {}&quot;, e);
+                 false
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get maximum concurrent tasks allowed
+     pub fn max_concurrent(&amp;self) -&gt; usize {
+         self.max_concurrent
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get number of CPU cores
+     pub fn cpu_cores(&amp;self) -&gt; usize {
+         self.cpu_cores
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for ResourceManager {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::new()
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use super::*;
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_resource_manager_creation() {
+         let manager = ResourceManager::new();
+         assert!(manager.cpu_cores() &gt; 0);
+         assert!(manager.max_concurrent() &gt; 0);
+         assert_eq!(manager.max_concurrent(), manager.cpu_cores() * 2);
+     }
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_acquire_and_release_slot() {
+         let manager = ResourceManager::with_multiplier(1);
+         let initial_available = manager.get_available_slots();
+         
+         {
+             let _guard = manager.acquire_slot().await.unwrap();
+             assert_eq!(manager.get_active_tasks().await, 1);
+             assert_eq!(manager.get_available_slots(), initial_available - 1);
+         }
+         
+         // Give time for Drop to execute
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(10)).await;
+         
+         // Slot should be released after guard is dropped
+         assert_eq!(manager.get_active_tasks().await, 0);
+         assert_eq!(manager.get_available_slots(), initial_available);
+     }
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_get_capacity() {
+         let manager = ResourceManager::with_multiplier(2);
+         let capacity = manager.get_capacity().await;
+         
+         assert_eq!(capacity.max_concurrent, manager.cpu_cores() * 2);
+         assert_eq!(capacity.active_tasks, 0);
+         assert_eq!(capacity.available_slots, capacity.max_concurrent);
+     }
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_get_system_stats() {
+         let manager = ResourceManager::new();
+         let stats = manager.get_system_stats().await.unwrap();
+         
+         assert!(stats.cpu_usage_percent &gt;= 0.0);
+         assert!(stats.cpu_usage_percent &lt;= 100.0);
+         assert!(stats.memory_total_bytes &gt; 0);
+         assert!(stats.memory_usage_percent &gt;= 0.0);
+         assert!(stats.memory_usage_percent &lt;= 100.0);
+         assert_eq!(stats.cpu_cores, manager.cpu_cores());
+     }
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_concurrent_acquisitions() {
+         let manager = Arc::new(ResourceManager::with_multiplier(1));
+         let max = manager.max_concurrent();
+         
+         let mut guards = Vec::new();
+         for _ in 0..max {
+             let guard = manager.acquire_slot().await.unwrap();
+             guards.push(guard);
+         }
+         
+         assert_eq!(manager.get_active_tasks().await, max);
+         assert_eq!(manager.get_available_slots(), 0);
+         
+         // Drop all guards
+         drop(guards);
+         
+         // Give time for Drop to execute
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_millis(50)).await;
+         
+         assert_eq!(manager.get_active_tasks().await, 0);
+         assert_eq!(manager.get_available_slots(), max);
+     }
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
+     /// Cleanup all worktrees
+     async fn cleanup_worktrees(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let worktrees = self.worktree_cleanup.read().await;
+         
+         if worktrees.is_empty() {
+             return Ok(());

+                 tracing::warn!(&quot;Failed to cleanup worktree {}: {}&quot;, worktree.name, e);
+             }
+         }
+         
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Drop for ParallelOrchestrator {
+     fn drop(&amp;mut self) {
+         // Spawn a task to cleanup worktrees
+         let worktree_cleanup = Arc::clone(&amp;self.worktree_cleanup);
+         let repo_path = self.repo_path.clone();
+         
+         tokio::spawn(async move {
+             let worktrees = worktree_cleanup.read().await;
+             
+             if !worktrees.is_empty() {
+                 if let Ok(manager) = WorktreeManager::new(&amp;repo_path) {
+                     for worktree in worktrees.iter() {
+                         let _ = manager.remove_worktree(&amp;worktree.name);
+                     }
+                 }
+             }
+         });
+     }
  }
```

```diff
+ //! Orchestration tool handler implementation
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use codex_core::orchestration::{AgentTask, AgentType, ParallelOrchestrator, ResourceManager, TaskStatus};
+ use mcp_types::CallToolResult;
+ use serde::Deserialize;
+ use serde_json::json;
+ use std::path::PathBuf;
+ use uuid::Uuid;
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct OrchestrateParallelParams {
+     pub prompts: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub agent_types: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     #[serde(default)]
+     pub repo_path: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn handle_orchestrate_parallel(
+     params: OrchestrateParallelParams,
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;CallToolResult&gt; {
+     // Validate input
+     if params.prompts.len() != params.agent_types.len() {
+         return Ok(CallToolResult {
+             content: vec![mcp_types::Content::Text {
+                 text: format!(
+                     &quot;Error: Number of prompts ({}) must match number of agent_types ({})&quot;,
+                     params.prompts.len(),
+                     params.agent_types.len()
+                 ),
+             }],
+             is_error: Some(true),
+         });
+     }
+ 
+     let repo_path = params
+         .repo_path
+         .as_deref()
+         .map(PathBuf::from)
+         .unwrap_or_else(|| PathBuf::from(&quot;.&quot;));
+ 
+     let mut orchestrator = ParallelOrchestrator::with_repo_path(&amp;repo_path)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to create orchestrator&quot;)?;
+ 
+     // Create tasks
+     let tasks: Vec&lt;AgentTask&gt; = params
+         .prompts
+         .iter()
+         .zip(params.agent_types.iter())
+         .map(|(prompt, agent_type)| AgentTask {
+             id: Uuid::new_v4().to_string(),
+             agent: parse_agent_type(agent_type),
+             prompt: prompt.clone(),
+             status: TaskStatus::Pending,
+             progress: 0.0,
+             result: None,
+         })
+         .collect();
+ 
+     // Execute in parallel
+     let results = orchestrator
+         .execute_parallel(tasks)
+         .await
+         .context(&quot;Failed to execute parallel tasks&quot;)?;
+ 
+     // Format results as JSON
+     let results_json = json!({
+         &quot;total&quot;: results.len(),
+         &quot;successful&quot;: results.iter().filter(|r| r.success).count(),
+         &quot;failed&quot;: results.iter().filter(|r| !r.success).count(),
+         &quot;results&quot;: results.iter().map(|r| {
+             json!({
+                 &quot;agent&quot;: format!(&quot;{:?}&quot;, r.agent),
+                 &quot;success&quot;: r.success,
+                 &quot;output&quot;: r.output,
+                 &quot;error&quot;: r.error
+             })
+         }).collect::&lt;Vec&lt;_&gt;&gt;()
+     });
+ 
+     Ok(CallToolResult {
+         content: vec![mcp_types::Content::Text {
+             text: serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;results_json)?,
+         }],
+         is_error: Some(false),
+     })
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn handle_get_resource_capacity() -&gt; Result&lt;CallToolResult&gt; {
+     let manager = ResourceManager::new();
+     let capacity = manager.get_capacity().await;
+ 
+     let result_json = json!({
+         &quot;cpu_usage_percent&quot;: capacity.cpu_usage_percent,
+         &quot;memory_usage_percent&quot;: capacity.memory_usage_percent,
+         &quot;max_concurrent_tasks&quot;: capacity.max_concurrent_tasks
+     });
+ 
+     Ok(CallToolResult {
+         content: vec![mcp_types::Content::Text {
+             text: serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;result_json)?,
+         }],
+         is_error: Some(false),
+     })
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn handle_get_system_stats() -&gt; Result&lt;CallToolResult&gt; {
+     let manager = ResourceManager::new();
+     let stats = manager
+         .get_system_stats()
+         .await
+         .context(&quot;Failed to get system stats&quot;)?;
+ 
+     let result_json = json!({
+         &quot;cpu_count&quot;: stats.cpu_count,
+         &quot;total_memory_gb&quot;: stats.total_memory_gb,
+         &quot;available_memory_gb&quot;: stats.available_memory_gb,
+         &quot;used_memory_gb&quot;: stats.used_memory_gb,
+         &quot;load_average&quot;: stats.load_average
+     });
+ 
+     Ok(CallToolResult {
+         content: vec![mcp_types::Content::Text {
+             text: serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;result_json)?,
+         }],
+         is_error: Some(false),
+     })
+ }
+ 
+ fn parse_agent_type(agent: &amp;str) -&gt; AgentType {
+     match agent.to_lowercase().as_str() {
+         &quot;codex&quot; =&gt; AgentType::Codex,
+         &quot;gemini&quot; =&gt; AgentType::Gemini,
+         &quot;claude&quot; =&gt; AgentType::Claude,
+         _ =&gt; AgentType::Codex,
+     }
+ }
+ 
```
